items.title: Small and City-Smart, Microvans Proliferate
items.abstract: Small cargo vans, like the Ford Transit Connect, have become a familiar sight in American cities. The latest entry in the class is the Chevrolet City Express.

items.title: Smart City Technology May Be Vulnerable to Hackers
items.abstract: A security researcher has found that the sensor technology being used to control everything from traffic lights to water systems is often installed and managed without proper security measures.

items.title: ‘The Geography of Genius,’ by Eric Weiner
items.abstract: A tour of some of the world’s exceptional places.
keywords: The Geography of Genius: A Search for the World's Most Creative Places From Ancient Athens to Silicon Valley (Book)

items.title: A Safety Plan With Swedish Logic and City Smarts
items.abstract: New York can learn a lot from Sweden, which has tamped down on traffic fatalities by focusing on design and technological solutions rather than by placing the onus on the driver.

items.title: Smart Cities Could Hold Hope for India's Rural Poor
items.abstract: Some city dwellers may have romantic notions about the traditional Indian village, but it is a treacherous place for the poor.
